titleStmt.title: W. B. Read et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2355

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Hodgnville Ky. Oct 4 1860
His Excellency
Gov. Magoffin
Dear sir

Their is a vacancy now in this the 1st the Justices district of Magistrate ^for Larue Conty^ occasioned by the resignation of Lewis Read Esqr, and the citizens of this town and district ^desire^ that one be appointed who lives in the town of Hodgnville and in looking round for the purpose of ascertaining who would best suit the people and give general Satisfaction, we have come to the conclusion that our townsman George W Brownfield is the man, and we therefore solicit his appoitmt Mr. Brownfield is and always has been a good and constant Democrat and is well calculatd to fill the office, his appoitmt will confer a lasting favor on your friends

W B Read
W, H, Hamilton
A M Jones
H S Johnson
J, F. Cessna P. J L C
William Robertson

Larue Co.
J P.
G. W. Brownfield
vice
Lewis Read
comd Nov. 8. 1860
